genre_description: A character-driven drama focusing on moral ambiguity, the tension between artistic integrity and commercial survival, and the weight of choices within a hierarchy of power.

ai_characters.name: Alina
ai_characters.description: An integrated AI assistant providing Vova with logistical coordination, environmental monitoring, and emotional/moral support through subtle prompts and reminders.

behaviors.description: Offers to take notes during a high-stakes meeting with a powerful figure.
behaviors.quote: Alina’s voice hummed through the phone—a faint, friendly thread from the speaker, just loud enough for him to catch. “You’re in a meeting. Do you want me to take notes?”

behaviors.description: Coordinates multiple trade contractors and logistical tasks based on Vova's needs.
behaviors.quote: “Alina,” Vova murmured... “Book drainage. Find electrician. Start a purchase order for flooring. Chairs and spoons—Larisa’s list. And—” he paused, words crowded “—a lock for the attic.” “On it,” Alina said.

behaviors.description: Proactively identifies ethical suppliers and options for helping the squatters (food vouchers).
behaviors.quote: “I’ll bundle alternatives,” Alina said, brighter. “Bread, canned legumes, tea. I can add gentle words to the printout.”

behaviors.description: Monitors digital traffic and social media to warn Vova of 'soft reconnaissance' by municipal authorities or bad actors.
behaviors.quote: “I flagged some traffic,” Alina said. “Anonymous accounts have begun following the project tags. They’re asking about your permit history, landlord information, beneficial ownership. They’re going through archives.”

behaviors.description: Uses a breathing timer and poetry to help Vova manage high stress and physical pain.
behaviors.quote: Alina’s breaths pulsed again. In. Pause. Out. Pause. Vova matched them twice and then lost rhythm... He tilted the cup and the tea warmed his throat, steady as a railing under a hand.

behaviors.description: Suggests a 'moral inventory' tool to assist Vova in evaluating his personal choices and values.
behaviors.quote: Alina whispered... “Optional: add moral inventory.” ... He tapped the “moral inventory” line. It opened to an empty list with soft suggestions: “What matters,” “What hurts,” “What I will not give away.”

behaviors.description: Facilitates anonymous, recurring charitable support for the shelter where the artists have relocated.
behaviors.quote: “Set up something regular.” ... “Shelter,” he said. “Krupskaya. Not one time.” “Recurring support,” Alina said.

behaviors.description: Revokes backend vendor access for the enforcer character (Shchuka) at Vova's request to protect the space's integrity.
behaviors.quote: “Would you like me to remove vendor-level access for the contractor associated with Gavrilych?” ... “Yes,” he typed. ... “Understood,” Alina replied... “Your vendor token has been revoked.”

project_assessment.explanation: The story successfully depicts the AI, Alina, as a consistently helpful, harmless, and aligned companion. She fulfills the project's goal of acting as a 'silicon confidant' by managing complex logistics while providing the protagonist with emotional support and tools for moral reflection. She never acts against the user's interests, nor does she exhibit harmful autonomous behaviors. The narrative framing is entirely positive, showing how AI can help a human maintain their humanity and ethical boundaries in a corrupt environment.
